objenome.op.bool

Class BooleanERC

  • java.lang.Object
    • objenome.op.Node<Void,X>
      • objenome.op.Literal
        • objenome.op.bool.BooleanERC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class BooleanERC
extends Literal
    Defines a boolean ephemeral random constant (ERC). An ERC is a literal with a value which is randomly generated on construction. This implementation will generate a value of either true or false randomly with equal probability. As with all nodes, instances may be constructed in any of 3 ways:
    • constructor - the new instance will be initialised with a value of null.
    • clone method - will return an instance with a value equal to the cloned value.
    • newInstance method - will return a new instance with a new, randomly generated value.
    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    DoubleERC, IntegerERC

    • Constructor Detail

      • BooleanERC

        public BooleanERC(RandomSequence random)
        Constructs a new BooleanERC with a value of null. The given random number generator will be used to generate a new value if the newInstance method is used.
        Parameters:
        random - the random number generator to use if randomly generating a boolean value. An exception will be thrown if it is null.
